page.title: 10CARSPHAIRN CH/WOMAN'S GUILD
page.content: So far as is known the Carsphairn Church Woman's Guild began as a work party, some time after 1925, with tea seved in the manse by the minister's mother.When the minister married, his wife formed a guild.Fees were 2/6 per year.Current fees are Â£1 per session. Meetings are held in Lagwyne Hall once a month from October to March,the October meeting being the dedication service conducted by the minister. A meeting consists of an opening and a closing hymn,a bible reading, a prayer and talk _ the subject usually connected with church or missions. There used to be an annual outing, but this has been discontinued, though visits take place to other Guilds. The Guild holds an annual sale of work, where the proceeds go in aid of the Christmas Treat for the senior citizens of the parish,and to charity.
